member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Properties.Exceptions.ModelNotRegistered
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to There is no model '{0}' registered with the model attribute, so the ViewModelToModel attribute on property '{1}' is invalid.
Make sure that the property is a Catel property, not a regular property.
If you are sure that you have a model with this name, make sure it's public instead of private or protected for Silverlight and WP7 because non-public reflection is not allowed in Silverlight..

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.CompositeCommand.CheckCanExecuteOfAllCommandsToDetermineCanExecuteForCompositeCommand
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether this command should check the can execute of all commands to determine can execute for composite command.
The default value is true which means the composite command can only be executed if all commands can be executed. If there is a requirement to allow partial invocation, set this property to false.
member.value: The check can execute of all commands to determine can execute for composite command.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.CompositeCommand.AllowPartialExecution
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether partial execution of commands is allowed. If this value is true, this composite command will always be executable and only invoke the internal commands that are executable.
The default value is false.
member.value: true if partial execution is allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.CompositeCommand.AtLeastOneMustBeExecutable
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether at least one command must be executable. This will prevent the command to be executed without any commands.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if at least one command must be executed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.IAuthenticationProvider
member.summary: Interface to allow an authentication mechanism to control the CanExecute state of a command.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IAuthenticationProvider.CanCommandBeExecuted(Catel.MVVM.ICatelCommand,System.Object)
member.summary:
Determines whether the specified can be executed. The class implementing this interface can use any required method to check the command.
It is recommended to use the property to identify a command.
member.returns: true if the specified command can be excecuted; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The CanExecute state of a command is queried a lot. The command itself does not cache any results because it is not aware of role or identity changes. If caching is required, this must be implemented in the class implementing the interface.a

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IAuthenticationProvider.HasAccessToUIElement(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary:
Determines whether the user has access to the specified . This method is invoked by the Authentication behavior, and can be used to disable or hide UI elements based on a role or any other authentication mechanism.
This method will only be called for UI elements with the Authentication behavior.
member.param: The authentication tag specified by the calling object.
member.returns: true if the user has access to the specified UI element; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ICatelCommand.Tag

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.Converters.ValueConverterGroup
member.summary:
A value converter which contains a list of IValueConverters and invokes their Convert or ConvertBack methods in the order that they exist in the list. The output of one converter is piped into the next converter allowing for modular value converters to be chained together. If the ConvertBack method is invoked, the value converters are executed in reverse order (highest to lowest index). Do not leave an element in the Converters property collection null, every element must reference a valid IValueConverter instance. If a value converter's type is not decorated with the ValueConversionAttribute, an InvalidOperationException will be thrown when the converter is added to the Converters collection.
Known limitations: the supplied parameter is used for ALL! converters.
member.remarks: Original source: http://www.codeproject.com/KB/WPF/PipingValueConverters_WPF.aspx

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ILocator.NamingConventions
member.summary:
Gets or sets the naming conventions to use to locate types.
By adding or removing conventions to this property, the service can use custom resolving of types.
Each implementation should add its own default naming convention.
member.remarks: Keep in mind that all results are cached. The cache itself is not automatically cleared when the are changed. If the are changed, the cache must be cleared manually.

This method is abstract because each locator should or could use its own naming convention to resolve the type. The method has prepared all the values such as the assembly name and the only thing this method has to do is to actually resolve a string value based on the specified naming convention.
member.param: The full type name of the type to resolve.
The naming convention to use for resolving.
member.returns: The resolved naming convention.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ViewLocator.GetDefaultNamingConventions
member.summary: Gets the default naming conventions.
member.returns: An enumerable of default naming conventions.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlBehavior
member.summary: A implementation for a user control.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlBehavior.CloseViewModelOnUnloaded
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user control should close any existing view model when the control is unloaded from the visual tree.
Set this property to false if a view model should be kept alive and re-used for unloading/loading instead of creating a new one.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the view model should be closed when the control is unloaded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlBehavior.SupportParentViewModelContainers
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether parent view model containers are supported. If supported, the user control will search for a that implements the interface. During this search, the user control will use both the visual and logical tree.
If a user control does not have any parent control implementing the interface, searching for it is useless and requires the control to search all the way to the top for the implementation. To prevent this from happening, set this property to false.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if parent view model containers are supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlBehavior.SkipSearchingForInfoBarMessageControl
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to skip the search for an info bar message control. If not skipped, the user control will search for a the first InfoBarMessageControl that can be found. During this search, the user control will use both the visual and logical tree.
If a user control does not have any InfoBarMessageControl, searching for it is useless and requires the control to search all the way to the top for the implementation. To prevent this from happening, set this property to true.
The default value is determined by the property.
member.value: true if the search for an info bar message control should be skipped; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlBehavior.DefaultSkipSearchingForInfoBarMessageControlValue
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the property. This way, the behavior can be changed an entire application to prevent disabling it on every control.
The default value is false.
member.remarks: Internally this value uses the property.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlBehavior.DisableWhenNoViewModel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user control should automatically be disabled when there is no active view model.
member.value: true if the user control should automatically be disabled when there is no active view model; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlBehavior.CreateLogic
member.summary: Creates the logic required for MVVM.
member.returns: The implementation uses by this behavior.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.WindowBehavior.Save
member.summary:
Gets or sets the save action.
The format is [controlname].[event]. By default, the Click event is used, thus for a button [controlname] is sufficient.
This property is not required, but if it is used, it must be valid otherwise an exception will be thrown.

This property is not required, but if it is used, it must be valid otherwise an exception will be thrown.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.WindowBehavior.ForceCloseAfterSettingDialogResult
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the logic should call Close immediately when the DialogResult is set.
By default, the Window class correctly closes the window when the DialogResult is set, but not all implementations work like this.

Gets a value indicating whether the control can be loaded. This is very useful in non-WPF classes where the LayoutUpdated is used instead of the Loaded event.
If this value is true, this logic implementation can call the when the control is loaded. Otherwise, the call will be ignored.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlLogic.CloseViewModelOnUnloaded
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user control should close any existing view model when the control is unloaded from the visual tree.
Set this property to false if a view model should be kept alive and re-used for unloading/loading instead of creating a new one.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the view model should be closed when the control is unloaded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlLogic.SupportParentViewModelContainers
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether parent view model containers are supported. If supported, the user control will search for the interface. During this search, the user control will use both the visual and logical tree.
If a user control does not have any parent control implementing the interface, searching for it is useless and requires the control to search all the way to the top for the implementation. To prevent this from happening, set this property to false.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if parent view model containers are supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlLogic.UnloadBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the unload behavior when the data context of the target control changes.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlLogic.DefaultUnloadBehaviorValue
member.summary:
Gets or sets the default value for the property.
The default value is .

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlLogic.TransferStylesAndTransitionsToViewModelGrid
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the styles and transitions from the content of the target control should be transfered to the view model grid which is created dynamically,.
The transfer is required to enable visual state transitions on root elements (which is replaced by this logic implementation).
The default value is false.
member.value: true if the styles and transitions should be transfered to the view model grid; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlLogic.DefaultTransferStylesAndTransitionsToViewModelGridValue
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the property. This way, the behavior can be changed an entire application to prevent disabling it on every control.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlLogic.SkipSearchingForInfoBarMessageControl
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to skip the search for an info bar message control. If not skipped, the user control will search for a the first that can be found. During this search, the user control will use both the visual and logical tree.
If a user control does not have any , searching for it is useless and requires the control to search all the way to the top for the implementation. To prevent this from happening, set this property to true.
The default value is determined by the property.
member.value: true if the search for an info bar message control should be skipped; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlLogic.DefaultSkipSearchingForInfoBarMessageControlValue
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the property. This way, the behavior can be changed an entire application to prevent disabling it on every control.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Providers.UserControlLogic.CreateWarningAndErrorValidatorForViewModel
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create a for the current control.
If a user control does not have any or equivalent control, it is useless to create a for the current control.
The default value is determined by the property.
member.value: true if the should be created; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.Providers.WindowLogic
member.summary: MVVM Provider behavior implementation for a window.
member.remarks:
Some parts in this class (with the instances and increments), but this is required to dynamically subscribe to an even that we do not know the handler of on forehand. Normally, you would do this via an anynomous delegate, but that doesn't work so the event delegate is created via ILGenerator at runtime.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8122085/calling-an-instance-method-when-event-occurs/8122242#8122242.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.ValidationToViewModelAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to gather validation from a in a property, which must be of type .
member.example:
The attribute must be used like this and all validations with the tag PersonValidationTag will be gathered into the summary:
[ValidationToViewModel("PersonValidationTag")] public IValidationSummary PersonValidationSummary { get; set; }
member.remarks: This attribute can only be used inside a view model.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ValidationToViewModelAttribute.UseTagToFilter
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether this attribute should use the tag to filter the validation.
If the value is true, the validation will be filtered on the tag. Otherwise, all validation results will be returned. Keep in mind that the can still be null, even when this value is true.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if [use tag to filter]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IViewModel.ValidateViewModel(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates the specified notify changed properties only.
member.param: if set to true, a validation is forced (even if the object knows it is already validated).

if set to true only the properties for which the warnings or errors have been changed will be updated via ; otherwise all the properties that had warnings or errors but not anymore and properties still containing warnings or errors will be updated.
member.returns: true if validation succeeds; otherwise false.
member.remarks: This method is useful when the view model is initialized before the window, and therefore WPF does not update the errors and warnings.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IViewModel.InitializeViewModel
member.summary:
Initializes the view model. Normally the initialization is done in the constructor, but sometimes this must be delayed to a state where the associated UI element (user control, window, ...) is actually loaded.
This method is called as soon as the associated UI element is loaded.
member.remarks:
It's not recommended to implement the initialization of properties in this method. The initialization of properties should be done in the constructor. This method should be used to start the retrieval of data from a web service or something similar.
During unit tests, it is recommended to manually call this method because there is no external container calling this method.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IViewModel.InitializeViewModelAsync
member.summary:

It's not recommended to implement the initialization of properties in this method. The initialization of properties should be done in the constructor. This method should be used to start the retrieval of data from a web service or something similar.
During unit tests, it is recommended to manually call this method because there is no external container calling this method.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode
member.summary: Specifies the different mapping modes available for the .

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.TwoWay
member.summary: Automatically maps the property from view model to model and back as soon as either one changes the property value.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.OneWay
member.summary:
Automatically maps the property from the model to the view model if the model changes the property value.
This mode does not map any values from the view model to the model, thus can also be seen as read-only mode.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.OneWayToSource
member.summary:
Automatically maps the property from the view model to the model if the view model changes the property value.
This mode does not map any values from the model to the view model, but still keeps track of all validation that occurs in the model.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.Explicit
member.summary: Automatically maps properties from the model to the view model as soon as the model is initialized. As soon as a property value changes in the model, the view model value is updated instantly. However, the mapping from the view model to model is explicit.

member.summary:
Gets the validation string from the object. This method supports the following types:

* ValidationResult

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ModelErrorInfo.InitializeDefaultErrors(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.ValidationResult})
member.summary: Initializes the default errors.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ModelErrorInfo.ClearDefaultErrors(System.String)
member.summary:
Updates the default errors. This method is required when errors are initialize via . This method checks whether default errors were added for a specific property (or at entity level if is or null).
Reason for this is that if the error is known on forehand, the entity implementation will not raise the event.
If the default errors are cleared, the validation via will take over from this point.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBase.InitializeViewModel
member.summary:
Initializes the view model. Normally the initialization is done in the constructor, but sometimes this must be delayed to a state where the associated UI element (user control, window, ...) is actually loaded.
This method is called as soon as the associated UI element is loaded.
member.returns: The task.
member.remarks:
It's not recommended to implement the initialization of properties in this method. The initialization of properties should be done in the constructor. This method should be used to start the retrieval of data from a web service or something similar.
During unit tests, it is recommended to manually call this method because there is no external container calling this method.

member.name: E:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBase.NavigationCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when the navigation is completed.
member.remarks:
This should of course be a cleaner solution, but there is no other way to let a view-model know that navigation has completed. Another option is injection, but this would require every view-model for Windows Phone 7 to accept only the navigation context, which has actually nothing to do with the logic.
It is also possible to use the event.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBase.UpdateNavigationContext(Catel.MVVM.Navigation.NavigationContext)
member.summary: Updates the navigation context. The navigation context provided by this class is different from the . Therefore, this method updates the navigation context to match it to the values of the .

member.summary: Called when the navigation has completed.
member.remarks:

member.summary: Dictionary of properties that are decorated with the . These properties should be updated after each validation sequence.

member.summary: A date/time with the latest update stamp of each validation summary.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBase.DeferValidationUntilFirstSaveCall
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether all validation should be deferred until the first call to .
If this value is true, all validation will be suspended. As soon as the first call is made to the , the validation will no longer be suspended and activated.
The default value is false.
member.value: true if the validation should be deferred; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If this value is used, it must be set as first property in the view model because the validation kicks in immediately when properties change.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBase.ValidateModelsOnInitialization
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to validate the models as soon as they are initialized. This means that as soon as a model value is set, the view model checks whether the entity already contains errors.
If this value is true, the errors will immediately be returned for mappings on the model. Otherwise, the errors will only become available when a value is entered and then being undone.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if the models should be validated on initialization; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBase.ValidateViewModel(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates the specified notify changed properties only.
member.param: If set to true, a validation is forced (even if the object knows it is already validated).

if set to true only the properties for which the warnings or errors have been changed will be updated via ; otherwise all the properties that had warnings or errors but not anymore and properties still containing warnings or errors will be updated.
member.returns: true if validation succeeds; otherwise false.
member.remarks: This method is useful when the view model is initialized before the window, and therefore WPF does not update the errors and warnings.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelFactory
member.summary:
Default implementation of the which allows custom instantation of view models. This way, if a view model contains a complex constructor or needs caching, this factory can be used.
This default implementation will first try to inject the data context into the view model constructor. If that is not possible, it will try to call the empty or default constructor.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelFactory.CanReuseViewModel(System.Type,System.Type,System.Type,Catel.MVVM.IViewModel)
member.summary:
Determines whether the specified view model as data context can be reused and allow the view to set itself as owner of the inherited view model.
By default a view model is allowed to be inherited when it is of the same type as the expected view model type.
member.param: The expected view model type according to the view.
The actual view model type which is the type of the .
The view model as data context which must be checked.
member.returns: true if the specified view model instance ben be reused by the view; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.Views.ViewToViewModelMappingType
member.summary: Mapping types for the .

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.Views.ViewToViewModelMappingType.TwoWayDoNothing
member.summary:
Two way, which means that either the view or the view model will update the values of the other party as soon as they are updated.
When this value is used, nothing happens when the view model of the view changes. This way, it might be possible that the values of the view and the view model are different. The first one to update next will update the other.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.Views.ViewToViewModelMappingType.TwoWayViewWins
member.summary:
Two way, which means that either the view or the view model will update the values of the other party as soon as they are updated.
When this value is used, the value of the view is used when the view model of the view is changed, and is directly transferred to the view model value.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.Views.ViewToViewModelMappingType.TwoWayViewModelWins
member.summary:
Two way, which means that either the view or the view model will update the values of the other party as soon as they are updated.
When this value is used, the value of the view model is used when the view model of the view is changed, and is directly transferred to the view value.

member.summary: The mapping is from the view to the view model only.

member.summary: The mapping is from the view model to the view only.

member.summary: Interface defining functionality for user controls.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Views.IUserControl.CloseViewModelOnUnloaded
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user control should close any existing view model when the control is unloaded from the visual tree.
Set this property to false if a view model should be kept alive and re-used for unloading/loading instead of creating a new one.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the view model should be closed when the control is unloaded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Views.IUserControl.SupportParentViewModelContainers
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether parent view model containers are supported. If supported, the user control will search for a DependencyObject that implements the interface. During this search, the user control will use both the visual and logical tree.
If a user control does not have any parent control implementing the interface, searching for it is useless and requires the control to search all the way to the top for the implementation. To prevent this from happening, set this property to false.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if parent view model containers are supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Views.IUserControl.SkipSearchingForInfoBarMessageControl
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to skip the search for an info bar message control. If not skipped, the user control will search for a the first that can be found. During this search, the user control will use both the visual and logical tree.
If a user control does not have any , searching for it is useless and requires the control to search all the way to the top for the implementation. To prevent this from happening, set this property to true.
The default value is false.
member.value: true if the search for an info bar message control should be skipped; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Views.IUserControl.DisableWhenNoViewModel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user control should automatically be disabled when there is no active view model.
member.value: true if the user control should automatically be disabled when there is no active view model; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.Views.IViewPropertySelector
member.summary:
Selector class to keep the view property selections to a minimum. Catel uses a special wrapping technology to wrap bindings to view properties to be able to add change notifications for all target platforms.
Though this technology works great, it might have impact on performance and this is not always necessary. By customizing the , developers can tweak the interesting view properties per type.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.Views.ViewLoadManager
member.summary:
Manager that handles top => bottom loaded events for all views inside an application.
The reason this class is built is that in non-WPF technologies, the visual tree is loaded from bottom => top. However, Catel heavily relies on the order to be top => bottom.
This manager subscribes to both the Loaded and LayoutUpdated events. This is because in a nested scenario this will happen:
- UserControl 1 |- UserControl 2 |- UserControl 3
Will be executed in the following order:
Loaded (UC 3).
Loaded (UC 2).
Loaded (UC 1).
LayoutUpdated (UC 1).
LayoutUpdated (UC 2).
LayoutUpdated (UC 3).
member.remarks: To get the best performance, this class will only execute logic on silverlight systems. All other systems correctly support the loaded event.

member.summary: Occurs when any of the subscribed views are loaded.

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Controls.InfoBarMessageControl
member.summary: Control for displaying messages to the user.
member.remarks:
A long, long, long time ago, the messages were hold in a dependency property (DP). However, even though DP values are not static, several instances that were open at the same time were still clearing eachother values (thus it seemed the DP behaves like it's a static member). Therefore, the messages are now hold in a field, and all problems are now gone.
And the control lived happily ever after.

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl
member.summary: that supports MVVM by using a typed parameter. If the user control is not constructed with the right view model by the developer, it will try to create the view model itself. It does this by keeping an eye on the DataContext property. If the property changes, the control will check the type of the DataContext and try to create the view model by using the DataContext value as the constructor. If the view model can be constructed, the DataContext of the UserControl will be replaced by the view model.
member.remarks:
This control suffers a lot from the bugs, or features "by design" as Microsoft likes to call it, of WPF. Below are the most common issues that this control suffers from:
WPF sometimes invokes the Loaded multiple times, without invoking Unloaded.

member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the view model container should prevent the creation of a view model.
This property is very useful when using views in transitions where the view model is no longer required.
member.value: true if the view model container should prevent view model creation; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl.ViewModel
member.summary: Gets the view model that is contained by the container.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl.CloseViewModelOnUnloaded
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user control should close any existing view model when the control is unloaded from the visual tree.
Set this property to false if a view model should be kept alive and re-used for unloading/loading instead of creating a new one.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the view model should be closed when the control is unloaded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl.SupportParentViewModelContainers
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether parent view model containers are supported. If supported, the user control will search for a that implements the interface. During this search, the user control will use both the visual and logical tree.
If a user control does not have any parent control implementing the interface, searching for it is useless and requires the control to search all the way to the top for the implementation. To prevent this from happening, set this property to false.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if parent view model containers are supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl.UnloadBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the unload behavior when the data context of the target control changes.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl.DefaultUnloadBehaviorValue
member.summary:
Gets or sets the default value for the property.
The default value is .

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl.TransferStylesAndTransitionsToViewModelGrid
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the styles and transitions from the content of the target control should be transfered to the view model grid which is created dynamically,.
The transfer is required to enable visual state transitions on root elements (which is replaced by this logic implementation).
The default value is true/
member.value: true if the styles and transitions should be transfered to the view model grid; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl.DefaultTransferStylesAndTransitionsToViewModelGridValue
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value for the property. This way, the behavior can be changed an entire application to prevent disabling it on every control.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl.SkipSearchingForInfoBarMessageControl
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to skip the search for an info bar message control. If not skipped, the user control will search for a the first that can be found. During this search, the user control will use both the visual and logical tree.
If a user control does not have any , searching for it is useless and requires the control to search all the way to the top for the implementation. To prevent this from happening, set this property to true.
The default value is determined by the property.
member.value: true if the search for an info bar message control should be skipped; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.DelayBindingUpdate
member.summary: This behaviors sets the binding to and manually updates the binding from view to view model after the delay.

member.summary: The log.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.DelayBindingUpdate.UpdateDelay
member.summary:
Gets or sets the update delay.
This is the value that is used between updates in milliseconds. The binding will be updated after the delay. When a new value becomes available, the timer is reset and starts all over.
The default value is 100. If the value is smaller than 50, the value will be ignored and there will be no delay between the value change and binding update. If the value is higher than 5000, it will be set to 5000.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.DelayBindingUpdate.PropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property.
member.remarks: This property does not reflect to any changes, so this property must be set when the is loaded.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.DelayBindingUpdate.DependencyPropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the dependency property. This property is used before the . By default, this behavior tries to retrieve the dependency property via "[PropertyName]Property" (which is the default naming convention of dependency properties). In the rare case that this naming convention is not followed, it is possible to use this property.
member.remarks:
This property does not reflect to any changes, so this property must be set when the is loaded.
This property should only be used as backup if the property does not work.

member.summary: Gets the name of the used dependency property. This property is introduced because a in Silverlight doesn't have a name.

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.Focus
member.summary: Behavior to set focus to a . This behavior sets the focus only once on the first time the is loaded.
member.remarks: In Silverlight, focusing a control seems very, very hard. Just calling Focus() isn't enough, so a timer is used to set the timer 500 milliseconds after the user control has been loaded. This is customizable via the property.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.UpdateBindingOnTextChanged.UpdateDelay
member.summary:
Gets or sets the update delay.
This is the value that is used between updates in milliseconds. The binding will be updated when no new text change event is detected within the delay.
The default value is 250. If the value is smaller than 50, the value will be ignored and there will be no delay between the key down and the binding update. If the value is higher than 5000, it will be set to 5000.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.EventToCommand.PreventInvocationIfAssociatedObjectIsDisabled
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the invocation of the command should be prevented when the is disabled.
By default, this value is true.
This property is introduced to disable the default behavior. For example, when showing a window which will disable the underlying object, the command will no longer be invoked. While this is the recommended behavior in most cases, sometimes you just need to bypass the default functionality.
member.value: true if the invocation of the command should be prevented when the is disabled; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the associated object should be disabled when the command cannot be executed.

member.name: M:Catel.Windows.Threading.DispatcherExtensions.InvokeIfRequired(System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher,System.Action)
member.summary:
Executes the specified action asynchronously with the specified arguments on the thread that the Dispatcher was created on if required.

member.name: T:Catel.Services.CameraServiceBase
member.summary:
Base implementation of the . This implementation takes care of some protection code to prevent double initialization or forgotten initialization.
This class ensures that the service is running when setting or getting cricical properties or calling critical methods. This might look a bit dumb in the first place, but saves the developer of the end-classes lots of redundant checking.

member.summary: Shows the please wait window with the specified status text and executes the work delegate (in a background thread). When the work is finished, the please wait window will be automatically closed.
member.param: The status. When the string is null or empty, the default please wait text will be used.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.IPleaseWaitService.UpdateStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Updates the status text.
member.param: The status. When the string is null or empty, the default please wait text will be used.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.IPleaseWaitService.UpdateStatus(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Updates the status and shows a progress bar with the specified status text. The percentage will be automatically calculated.
The busy indicator will automatically hide when the is larger than .
When providing the , it is possible to use {0} (represents current item) and {1} (represents total items).
member.param: The status format. Can be empty, but not null.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.IPleaseWaitService.Hide
member.summary: Hides this please wait window.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.IPleaseWaitService.Push(System.String)
member.summary:
Increases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will increase.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To decrease the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.
member.param: The status to change the text to.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.IPleaseWaitService.Pop
member.summary:
Decreases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will decrease.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To increase the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.

member.name: P:Catel.Services.IPleaseWaitService.ShowCounter
member.summary:
Gets the show counter.
This property can be used to get the current show counter if the please wait window should be hidden for a moment.

member.name: T:Catel.Services.NamingConvention
member.summary: Class that is able to resolve naming conventions.

member.name: F:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.ViewModelName
member.summary:
The view model name constant that will be replaced by the naming convention. This constant will be replaced by the view model name without the "ViewModel" prefix.
For example, the following naming convention: [AS].UI.Views.[VM]View
will result in the following view for ExampleViewModel: MyAssembly.UI.Views.ExampleView.xaml

member.name: F:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.ViewName
member.summary:
The view name constant that will be replaced by the naming convention. This constant will be replaced by the view name without the "View", "Window" and "Control" prefix.
For example, the following naming convention: [AS].UI.Views.[VW]ViewModel
will result in the following view model for ExampleViewModel: MyAssembly.UI.Views.ExampleView.xaml

member.name: F:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.Assembly
member.summary:
The assembly constant that will be replaced by the naming convention. This constant will be replaced by the assembly name.
For example, the following naming convention: [AS].UI.Views.[VM]View
will result in the following view for ExampleViewModel: MyAssembly.UI.Views.ExampleView.xaml

member.name: F:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.Up
member.summary:
The up constant that will be replaced by the naming convention. This constant will be move up one step in the type namespace tree.
For example, the following naming convention: [UP].Views.[VM]View
will result in the following view for Catel.ViewModels.ExampleViewModel: Catel.Views.ExampleView.xaml

member.name: F:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.Current
member.summary:
The current constant that will keep the convention in the current namespace.
For example, the following naming convention: [CURRENT].[VM]View
will result in the following view for Catel.ExampleViewModel: Catel.ExampleView.xaml

member.name: M:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.ResolveViewByViewModelName(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Resolves the convention by using the view model name.
This method does not add assemblies or resolve types, but will only return a string containing the resolved value based on the convention.
The following constants can be used in this method: *
member.param: The assembly which is the base namespace.
Class name of the view model. This parameter must only contain the type name, not the full type. For example ExampleViewModel.
member.returns: The resolved convention.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.ResolveViewModelByViewName(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Resolves the convention by using the view name.
This method does not add assemblies or resolve types, but will only return a string containing the resolved value based on the convention.
The following constants can be used in this method: *
member.param: The assembly which is the base namespace.
Class name of the view. This parameter must only contain the type name, not the full type. For example ExampleView.
member.returns: The resolved convention.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.ResolveNamingConvention(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the naming convention.
member.param: The constants with values. The Key must be the constant as it will be used inside the convention. The Value is the value the constant must be replaced with.
member.returns: The resolved convention.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.ResolveNamingConvention(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the naming convention.
member.param: The constants with values. The Key must be the constant as it will be used inside the convention. The Value is the value the constant must be replaced with.
The value you try to resolve
member.returns: The resolved convention.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.GetParentPath(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the parent path with the separator of choice. For example, the following path:
Catel.Services
Will return the following value when using the dot (.) as separator:
Catel.MVVM
member.returns: The parent path.
member.remarks: This method automatically finds the parent separator by calling the and then calls .

member.name: M:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.GetParentPath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the parent path with the separator of choice. For example, the following path:
Catel.Services
Will return the following value when using the dot (.) as separator:
Catel.MVVM
member.returns: The parent path.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.NamingConvention.GetParentSeparator(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the parent separator.
This method tries to use the following separators:
Backslash (\)
Slash (/)
Dot (.)
Pipe (|)
member.returns: The separator or null if no known separator was found.

member.summary:
Gets the show counter.
This property can be used to get the current show counter if the please wait window should be hidden for a moment.

member.summary: Shows the please wait window with the specified status text.
member.param: The status. When the string is null or empty, the default please wait text will be used.
member.remarks: When this method is used, the method must be called to hide the window again.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.PleaseWaitService.Show(Catel.Services.PleaseWaitWorkDelegate,System.String)
member.summary: Shows the please wait window with the specified status text and executes the work delegate (in a background thread). When the work is finished, the please wait window will be automatically closed.
member.param: The status. When the string is null or empty, the default please wait text will be used.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.PleaseWaitService.UpdateStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Updates the status text.
member.param: The status. When the string is null or empty, the default please wait text will be used.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.PleaseWaitService.UpdateStatus(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Updates the status and shows a progress bar with the specified status text. The percentage will be automatically calculated.
The busy indicator will automatically hide when the is larger than .
When providing the , it is possible to use {0} (represents current item) and {1} (represents total items).
member.param: The status format. Can be empty, but not null.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.PleaseWaitService.Hide
member.summary: Hides this please wait window.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.PleaseWaitService.Push(System.String)
member.summary:
Increases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will increase.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To decrease the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.
member.param: The status to change the text to.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.PleaseWaitService.Pop
member.summary:
Decreases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will decrease.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To increase the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.Test.PleaseWaitService.UpdateStatus(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Updates the status and shows a progress bar with the specified status text. The percentage will be automatically calculated.
The busy indicator will automatically hide when the is larger than .
When providing the , it is possible to use {0} (represents current item) and {1} (represents total items).
member.param: The status format. Can be empty, but not null.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.Test.PleaseWaitService.Hide
member.summary: Hides this please wait window.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.Test.PleaseWaitService.Push(System.String)
member.summary:
Increases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will increase.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To decrease the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.
member.param: The status to change the text to.

member.name: M:Catel.Services.Test.PleaseWaitService.Pop
member.summary:
Decreases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will decrease.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To increase the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.
